memberdef.name: NFC_NDEF_URI_RECORD_DESC_DEF
memberdef.initializer: struct nfc_ndef_uri_rec_payload name##_ndef_uri_record_payload_desc = \ { \ .uri_id_code = (uri_id_code_arg), \ .uri_data = (uri_data_arg), \ .uri_data_len = (uri_data_len_arg) \ }; \ \ NFC_NDEF_GENERIC_RECORD_DESC_DEF(name, \ TNF_WELL_KNOWN, \ NULL, \ 0, \ &nfc_ndef_uri_rec_type, \ sizeof(nfc_ndef_uri_rec_type), \ nfc_ndef_uri_rec_payload_encode, \ &name##_ndef_uri_record_payload_desc) \

briefdescription.para: Macro for generating a description of a URI record.

detaileddescription.para: This macro initializes an instance of an NFC NDEF record description of a URI record.

simplesect.para: The record descriptor is declared as automatic variable, which implies that the NDEF message encoding (see nfc_ndef_uri_msg_encode) must be done in the same variable scope.

parameterdescription.para: URI identifier code that defines the protocol field of the URI.
Pointer to the URI string. The string should not contain the protocol field if the protocol was specified in uri_id_code.

briefdescription.para: Macro for accessing the NFC NDEF URI record descriptor instance that was created with NFC_NDEF_URI_RECORD_DESC_DEF.

detaileddescription.para: No prepending is done. Reserved for future use.

briefdescription.para: URI identifier codes according to "URI Record Type Definition" (denotation "NFCForum-TS-RTD_URI_1.0" published on 2006-07-24) chapter 3.2.2.
External reference to the type field of the URI record, defined in the file uri_rec.c. It is used in the NFC_NDEF_URI_RECORD_DESC_DEF macro.
Construct the payload for a URI record.

detaileddescription.para: This function encodes the payload according to the URI record definition. It implements an API compatible with payload_constructor_t.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the description of the payload.
Pointer to payload destination. If NULL, function will calculate the expected size of the URI record payload.
Size of available memory to write as input. Size of generated payload as output.
If the payload was encoded successfully.
If the predicted payload size is bigger than the provided buffer space.
